questions.question: What is QoS (Quality of Service)?
questions.explanation: QoS: ensure service quality. Types: traffic prioritization, bandwidth allocation. Methods: DiffServ, IntServ. Purpose: real-time applications. Example: voice over video. Complexity: management challenge.

questions.question: What is load balancing?
questions.explanation: Balancing: spread requests. Purpose: prevent overload. Methods: round-robin, least connection. Implementation: hardware or software. Benefit: scalability. Complexity: sophisticated algorithms.

questions.question: What is network redundancy?
questions.explanation: Redundancy: alternative routes available. Purpose: reliability, availability. Methods: multiple links, servers. Cost: more equipment. Benefit: uptime improvement. Critical: enterprise networks.

questions.question: What is MPLS (Multiprotocol Label Switching)?
questions.explanation: MPLS: labels attached to packets. Purpose: faster routing, traffic engineering. Speed: lookup by label not IP. Complexity: advanced technology. Application: ISP networks. Benefit: performance.

questions.question: What is SDN (Software-Defined Networking)?
questions.explanation: SDN: centralized control plane. Programmable: software controls routing. Benefit: flexibility, automation. Architecture: separate control/data. Modern: cloud networks. Complexity: paradigm shift.

questions.question: What is network segmentation?
questions.explanation: Segmentation: split into smaller networks. Purpose: security, performance. Methods: subnetting, VLANs. Benefit: isolate traffic, reduce congestion. Security: limit lateral movement. Importance: best practice.

questions.question: What is VLAN (Virtual LAN)?
questions.explanation: VLAN: logical grouping of devices. Purpose: segmentation without physical separation. Implementation: software-based. Benefit: flexibility, security. Usage: enterprise networks. Complexity: switch configuration.

questions.question: What is spanning tree protocol?
questions.explanation: STP: prevents switching loops. Mechanism: block redundant links. Purpose: stability. Implementation: automatic. Benefit: network reliability. Complexity: convergence time trade-off.

questions.question: What is network monitoring?
questions.explanation: Monitoring: real-time traffic analysis. Purpose: detect issues, optimize. Tools: SNMP, packet analyzers. Metrics: bandwidth, latency, packet loss. Importance: troubleshooting. Benefit: proactive management.

questions.question: What is network congestion?
questions.explanation: Congestion: packets exceed capacity. Effect: delays, packet loss. Causes: too many users/data. Solutions: increase bandwidth, QoS. Prevention: traffic shaping. Challenge: real-time adjustment.
